Summary: To estimate ratios of market values (equity and firm) to book value (equity and firm), with companion variables (ROE and ROC)
Vars: Number of firms in the industry grouping.
Aggregated market capitalization divided by aggregated book value of equity, across all firms in the group.
Measure of market value of equity, relative to accounting value of equity
Aggregate net income divided by aggregated book value of equity, across companies in group.
Measure of returns earned on projects, to equity investors
Aggregated enterprise value divided by aggregated invested capital, across all firms in the group. (EV = Market Cap + Debt - Cash, Invested Capital = BV of equity + Debt - Cash)
Measure of market value of firm,  relative to accounting value of firm
Aggregate after-tax operating income divided by aggregated invested capital, across companies in group.
Measure of returns earned on projects, to all claim holders
table_summary: This table provides financial metrics for various industries. It includes the number of firms in each industry, Price-to-Book Value ratio (PBV), Return on Equity (ROE), Enterprise Value to Invested Capital ratio (EV_Invested_Capital), and Return on Invested Capital (ROIC). These metrics are useful for analyzing the financial performance and valuation of firms within each industry.
